page.title: 08The Miner's strike 1984-5
page.content: During the miner's strike there were a lot of arguments in our house about money and bills. My mother does not go out to work and my brother and father are both miners. They were at home most of the day watching T.V. One of the many miners who live on our street was a working miner. People wrote 'scab' on his wall and no-one talked to him or his family. During the strike my pocket-money was cut from Â£2.50 to Â£1 and instead of going out three times a week my parents only went out twice a month. On my birthday my two sisters paid for the family to go out for a meal but at Christmas instead of a turkey we had a chicken and I hardly got any presents. My dad did not want to go back to work after the strike because his pit, {Kilnhurst,}was threatened with closure
